data.headline: Nasdaq 100 futures lead declines, down about 0.8%, while Dow futures slip around 0.2% in premarket action
bullets: Megacap tech stocks pressured by persistent AI disruption fears, job market concerns, and fresh competition from Alibaba’s Qwen 3.5
Chip stocks, software, logistics, financials, and real estate sectors also under pressure as tech weakness spills over
Recent selling extends back-to-back S&P 500 weekly losses and a five-week Nasdaq losing streak, marking the sharpest pullback since mid-November
Nvidia, Palantir, Synopsys, and Danaher trade lower in early moves
ZIM rises on Hapag-Lloyd merger deal, while Norwegian Cruise Line jumps on cruise-sector optimism
Warner Bros. Discovery gains on revived, higher-bid merger talks with Paramount, boosting media M&A sentiment

Traders face a thin data calendar today with NY Fed/Empire manufacturing and NAHB housing data ahead of key Fed minutes, jobs data, Q4 GDP, Friday’s PCE report, and a busy earnings week led by Walmart, DoorDash, and Palo Alto Networks
